pullrequest.title: More sensible default behavior for pkg-config entries

content.raw: Note that pkg-config unfortunately does not seem to support version information for "library" entries (as opposed to "module" entries), so we cannot provide the required version information to pkg-config.
content.html: Note that pkg-config unfortunately does not seem to support version information for "library" entries (as opposed to "module" entries), so we cannot provide the required version information to pkg-config.

pullrequest.title: More sensible default behavior for pkg-config entries

content.raw:
I'm not sure where this comment belongs.  `man pkg-config` says `Requires` and `Requires.private`  are "a comma-separated list of packages". With this pull request and a clean build of ignition_common on `default` the field has no commas in `ignition-common0.pc`.

```
prefix=/workspace/ws_ign/install_isolated/ign_common
libdir=${prefix}/lib
includedir=${prefix}/include/ignition/common0

Name: Ignition common
Description: A set of common classes for robot applications
Version: 0.5.0~pre1
Requires: ignition-math4 uuid gts libswscale libavdevice >= 56.4.100 libavformat libavcodec libavutil
Requires.private: tinyxml2
Libs: -L${libdir} -lignition-common0 
Libs.private: -ldl
CFlags: -I${includedir} 
```
content.html:
I'm not sure where this comment belongs. man pkg-config says Requires and Requires.private are "a comma-separated list of packages". With this pull request and a clean build of ignition_common on default the field has no commas in ignition-common0.pc.

prefix=/workspace/ws_ign/install_isolated/ign_common
libdir=${prefix}/lib
includedir=${prefix}/include/ignition/common0

Name: Ignition common
Description: A set of common classes for robot applications
Version: 0.5.0~pre1
Requires: ignition-math4 uuid gts libswscale libavdevice >= 56.4.100 libavformat libavcodec libavutil
Requires.private: tinyxml2
Libs: -L${libdir} -lignition-common0 
Libs.private: -ldl
CFlags: -I${includedir}

pullrequest.title: More sensible default behavior for pkg-config entries

content.raw: Ah, it's like that before this pull request too. Since it's unrelated I'll create an issue for this. (#8)
content.html: Ah, it's like that before this pull request too. Since it's unrelated I'll create an issue for this. (#8)

pullrequest.title: More sensible default behavior for pkg-config entries

content.raw: Maybe #8 is relevant here. Is it possible that if  `${${PACKAGE_NAME}_PKGCONFIG_TYPE}` is `PROJECT_PKGCONFIG_REQUIRES` then this needs a comma instead of a space?
content.html: Maybe #8 is relevant here. Is it possible that if ${${PACKAGE_NAME}_PKGCONFIG_TYPE} is PROJECT_PKGCONFIG_REQUIRES then this needs a comma instead of a space?

pullrequest.title: More sensible default behavior for pkg-config entries

content.raw:
Yes, this is where the commas would belong. I'm pretty sure it's been working with just spaces, and I believe I based the use of spaces off of examples that I found elsewhere, but I'm admittedly having a hard time finding such examples right now.

Of course it makes sense to just follow the manpages, so I have no problem with using comma separators. I'd even be fine with adding that to this PR after I wrap up the ign-transport stuff that I'm working on right now.
content.html:
Yes, this is where the commas would belong. I'm pretty sure it's been working with just spaces, and I believe I based the use of spaces off of examples that I found elsewhere, but I'm admittedly having a hard time finding such examples right now.

Of course it makes sense to just follow the manpages, so I have no problem with using comma separators. I'd even be fine with adding that to this PR after I wrap up the ign-transport stuff that I'm working on right now.
